I 'm fortunate in that my daughter 's fourth grade teacher has made this an incredibly smooth transition . Each morning she drops daily assignments into an online folder . She also has a half hour Google classroom lesson so the students can see each other and interact and ask questions . There 's a half hour Google Classroom literacy group and a half hour math group , both based on students ' skill levels . I help her with her math and make sure she 's staying on task with her assignments and we usually wrap up by  . The hardest part is keeping up with my own work . I feel badly for my daughter who misses seeing her peers and teacher face to face and for her teacher who is probably working twice as hard to teach the same curriculum . 
I have worked on basic life skills during this period . I am an only parent and have been working full time too from home mostly . Some of the things we have learned are how to cook omelets , bake bread , make a cake and clean the bathroom . I feel  practical skills are important this time .
